title: Measles outbreaks in an interconnected world
author: Ryan Bell Feature Writer; Bill; Melinda Gates Foundation
description: When immunization coverage drops due to lack of vaccinations, everyone in today's interconnected world is more vulnerable.
cleaned_text: Read next [Keeping vaccination goals close, no matter how afar](/ideas/articles/gates-foundation-vaccine-coverage-equity-orin-levine) New data released on July 16 showed that 9 in 10 infants worldwide received at least one dose of diphtheria-tetanus-pertussis (DTP) vaccines in 2017, illustrating the progress and challenges in achieving global immunization coverage. Dr. Orin Levine discusses his personal journey discovering the real value of vaccines and how the Gates Foundation is thinking about tricky issues such as equity and vaccine hesitancy. [The fight against antimicrobial resistance](/ideas/articles/antimicrobial-resistance-nepal-antibiotics-abhilasha-karkey) Abhilasha Karkey has made it her life's mission to look for new ways to combat antimicrobial resistance. She talks with The Optimist about the complicating factors of climate change and tourism, the necessity for clean water, and why she still believes in the "magic" of antibiotics.
